I highly recommend the Birria beef tacos and the papitas fritas. The pulled beef paired with the crunchy shells and flavourful bone broth is a perfect combination.

I would highly recommend this place. It has become a favourite of ours.

review_text:
This place has been on my list for a while, and we finally made it. When we arrived, there was a queue outside and it took over half an hour to get a table. It was absolutely freezing. I don’t usually wait in queues — that’s a big no for me — but we were already there, so we waited.

And it paid off.

Once inside, the place was warm and cozy, which felt incredible after standing in the cold. We ordered two cappuccinos, and they were excellent — properly hot and really well made.

My husband ordered the fried chicken waffle, and I had the sourdough with mushrooms and two poached eggs, plus two beef sausages on the side. That was a standout for me. You rarely see beef sausages offered; it’s almost always pork or vegetarian, and I don’t eat pork, so this was a big win.

Our daughter had French toast with honey and raspberry jam, and we also ordered her a hot chocolate (not pictured). Everything we ordered was excellent. The flavors were incredible and the portions were massive.

The bill came to around £50, and it matched the experience. The food lived up to the hype. One thing to note: the space is a little cramped, and the tables are quite close together.

Overall, a very strong spot. We will definitely be coming back again 🙌🏼🤩

review_text:
We visited Pica in Belfast for our first proper night out since having our daughter, and it couldn’t have been more special. From the moment we arrived, the host set the tone for the evening—incredibly personable, genuinely warm, and clearly passionate about making guests feel welcome. When she found out it was our first date night in six months, she surprised us with a glass of Prosecco each. Such a simple gesture, but it meant the world.
Since it had been so long, we didn’t hold back on ordering—and honestly, we’re glad we didn’t. The margaritas were divine, beautifully balanced and dangerously easy to drink. Every dish we tried hit the mark: the tacos were packed with flavour, the tostadas crisp and gorgeous, and each plate arrived looking as good as it tasted. Proper comfort, proper craft.
We even ended up taking a doggy bag home for the babysitters, who were very grateful.
Pica delivered everything we hoped for and more: great food, great drinks, and hospitality that felt heartfelt rather than rehearsed. A perfect spot for a date night, a treat, or any occasion where you want to feel looked after.
Can’t wait to go back. 🌮✨

review_text:
Pizza Punks is a pizzeria, centrally located in the cathedral quarter. We booked here to see what the vegan options were like as we had not visited in quite a few years.
We had the vegan meatball pizza and built our own, adding the vegan pepperoni for protein. I would say the meatballs are stand out and super flavourful, so would advise anyone to try them out first. I enjoyed the vegan pepperoni but the meatballs were a tough act to follow! The vegan cheese is also really enjoyable, striking a good balance between consistency and strength. I also love the dough as it is not very greasy or too thick.
Overall I would say the pizza is very tasty and for vegans you have some strong options to keep you coming back. My only criticism would be around service times, it seems like they need more staff or maybe even an app. This would help to get things moving quickly. For example our food came out before our drinks, which shows there is a disconnect somewhere in the process!
I would definitely advise coming here if you are in the mood for some delicious pizza with some unorthodox toppings 😊

review_text:
So, I went here with my wife and 3 year old son on a whim knowing it's always busy, with no expectations of getting in. Luckily we walked right up and got served by the most hospitable guy with a beard. When I told him I had never been before, he kindly talked me through how it all worked, what each dish was and made us feel very welcome. He also offered to exchange any food order we didn't like, which was a really nice touch for customer service. Honestly, it was a short but sweet interaction that made us feel welcome and appreciated - this makes all the difference in the world.

Of course we did not need to exchange any slices we ordered as they were all absolutely incredible. The pepperoni and Vodka Sausage were both fantastic. Would highly recommend both. My son had a classic slice of Margherita and he ate most of it without complaint (was slightly too big for him, but I gladly helped him finish the portion).

Will 100% come back on account of both food and service. As it is a bit more expensive than its competitors, the service really tipped the scales on whether or not I'd return. The pizza is top quality, but it's the service that made the whole thing exceptional.

review_text:
It's inside Deer's Head, without it's own individual signage.  So just go inside.

The seafood chowder is outstanding.  Served nice and hot, as all soup should be served but sadly is rare these days.   The shrimp in particular is cooked expertly just to the edge of being cooked.  You'll want to try one quickly, as the hot soup will continue to cook them.

The fish and chips also outstanding.  A delicate and crunchy coating.  Not greasy at all.  Fish fresh and moist.  The chips/fries are steak cut and lightly seasoned.  Gotta eat those Irish potatoes at every opportunity 😁

And an unexpected nice touch- the booth had two USB charging outlets.  Nice...

review_text:
We came here for our work's Christmas 'do'. It wasn't our first choices, but we wanted a good night out, and Revolutión de Cuba looked good - on paper.

The atmosphere was lively, any other night, it would be perfect. Unfortunately, it wasn't ideal for us; far too loud, so loud we couldn't hear what the person, who was sitting next to us, was saying. Usually on a 'work's night out', the ambient music is lower during meal times. I understand this is more of a club scene, and if we were just going to use it as such, it would be fine, and my ratings would reflect this, but as a Christmas meal venue, it did not work for us at this time.

The food came out promptly, as we had pre-ordered that was to be expected, my starter was nice, except I wasn't expecting hot chilli peppers on my prawn cocktail. I suppose that was a Mexican twist on a Christmas classic! My slow cooked beef was chewy and not very warm, but my pudding - banana Eton Mess - was delicious! For the price, I would've expected better.

All in all, as a Christmas meal venue, it did not work. As just a Christmas drinks night out, it would've been ok.

This month I and a few friends attended the Cookery School at Waterman House for a bread making course.

As I'm not very good at anything in the kitchen I was super worried about how I'd cope with making bread from scratch.

Turns out I'm OK at it, although I am going to say that was down to the very welcoming and supportive host Claire. She guided us all through the various breads.

We made 4 different loaves as well as 2 batches of Pizza dough each. Each person was able to make there own individual pizza, shown how to roll out the base and encouraged to load that bad boy up with as many toppings as we'd like. We each then sat and ate our beautiful pizza and sipped on a glass a wine to finish the session.

I can honestly say it was good fun and I learned a lot. I will definitely go back and do another masterclass. The list of classes available varied.

Thanks so much to all at Waterman House

review_text:
First time trying Stran-wiches today. My friend and I went at lunchtime for takeaway and were served immediately by a very pleasant member of staff. The music in the shop when we arrived was very loud, but a member of staff must have thought so too, and quickly turned it down a bit. I ordered the Reuben with pastrami, cheese, pickles, sauerkraut and mustard, and my friend ordered the Mexican chicken on a wrap. We waited less than 10 minutes until our order was ready, and we were able to pay separately using both cash and card payments.

Now, onto the sandwich itself. I personally didn't feel that it was worth £12 for the size of my Reuben, and at £11, my friends' wrap was even smaller still. My foccacia was quite dry, and I'd have loved either a dipping sauce or even a little bit of mayo in addition to the mustard. There was SO much sauerkraut that I couldn't taste the cheese at all. I love sauerkraut and pickles in general, but to have so much on there that it overpowered everything else was really disappointing. The flavour profile was just really unbalanced for my taste, though the pastrami when I tried it by itself, was thinly sliced and super tasty.

Now, onto the reason for the low rating. Most deli's will wrap a sandwich in paper, slice it in half, and THEN wrap it in foil. At Stran-wiches, they wrap it in the paper and foil and then slice it which means that when I went to eat my Reuben, I kept finding tiny bits of foil throughout the first few bites closest to where it had been cut. I found this really off-putting because it effectively forced me to use my fingers to dig through my sandwich to remove them, which on an airated bread like foccacia wasn't easy!! Such a silly mistake to make, but it significantly affected my enjoyment of my lunch, and my first impression of this place.

My friends opinion of her Mexican Chicken wrap was that everything was fresh and the texture of the wrap was so pleasant, but the sauce was so overpowering that it was all she could taste. After eating her wrap, she was still a bit hungry too, which after spending £11 definitely shouldn't be the case.

Overall, I'd probably go back to Stran-wiches and maybe try one of the salad bowls next time but I think, especially on Stranmillis where you have really class places to choose from for lunchtime offerings, it would be way lower down on my list.

review_text:
Embarrassing!

Went on Saturday evening for a meal and had called up prior to check some dietary requirements for gluten free items.. I was told a list of items that weren’t marked could be altered. Upon ordering I informed the server I had called earlier and the item I wanted was agreed to be made to suit, then when she brought the food she set it to me and I knew the bap on the burger wasn’t gluten free and was told before I even spoke that my meal wasn’t gluten free as I never requested it.. but I hadn’t even asked yet if it was definitely suitable for me.. the server knew she hadn’t noted the requirement when originally informed and had obviously tried to pass it off as my fault.. then told me chips aren’t suitable either and another server then interrupted and offered to just remove the bap and that chips were definitely ok even though she said there’s contamination in the fryer but no one had ever had a problem before with eating them so it’s ok.. as a coeliac this isn’t how cross contamination works if it’s present it will affect the person and the staff need a serious amount of training on this issue if you’re going to offer the gluten free service.. having the risk as gluten items are in the premises is one thing and different as it’s expected but to say that even though there’s definitely contamination but it’s ok.. this is wrong and very misleading. The embarrassment came from the servers being loud while discussing the issue with several other tables all looking to see what was going on, wouldn’t hurry back and couldn’t wait to leave especially with getting dirty looks from the staff.

Our hotel was located close to BaoBun Botanic, so we decided to stop by and try it out – and it turned out to be a great choice! The staff were very friendly and helpful from the moment we walked in, and they gave us good recommendations, which made a great first impression.
We ordered the bao bun set, the wings meal, and a half-and-half meal with fries, rice, and crispy chicken. Each set also comes with a drink, which is definitely a nice bonus. The portions are quite generous – one meal is more than enough to feel full and satisfied. As for the taste, everything was absolutely delicious: fresh ingredients, well-seasoned meat, and a great balance of flavours.
The restaurant is located on the ground floor, so it’s easy to access with a stroller. There is seating available inside, and a few tables outside as well, which is perfect if the weather is good.
We will definitely come back during our next visit to Belfast. BaoBun Botanic is a great spot – tasty food, reasonable prices, and very friendly service.

Food was excellent and was brought out quickly. Service initially was a tad slow but not enough to hinder the experience. The area we were in for food was quiet enough but definitely seemed like a lot of life in the next room (maybe the main bar area?)

Anywho, would highly recommend for a feed. We got 2 courses for £19 each on a Saturday night and was very happy with that.

Fish was absolutely fantastic and a great homemade curry to go along with it. Salt and chilli beef to start was great too, not chewy at all and full of flavour.

Would highly recommend

review_text:
Wow, wow, wow. Right let me start with the negative: it’s bloody hard to pick something off the menu. Like literally I was stood for like 5 solid minutes in complete indecision, there’s sooo much incredible looking stuff. I wanted the wings but it looks like they come in a massive portion and I already had more than enough.

In the end I ordered the bacon and cheese burger and the spice bag fries (way too much for one, but I really couldn’t pick). Served was prompt and very friendly. We took a seat and the food was all brought out surprisingly fast.

The burger was good and plenty of sauce for those that like it saucy. Overall - a good burger!

The real star here was the loaded fries though, wow, amazing. The curry sauce was just like what you’d get from a Chinese and there was just the right amount of chilli’s, spring onions etc on top. Bursting with flavour and the perfect amount of spice.

Not a Belfast native but can’t wait to get back and try something else 😋
